segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool first, and my heart skips a beat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s stretching so far up, and that stool looks like it’s about to tip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for a cookie like it’s no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe the woman hasn’t turned around yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just drying that plate, completely oblivious to the water everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is overflowing, and she’s standing right in the middle of it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll slip before she even notices the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, like nothing is happening inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost like two different worlds in one scene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone stops the kids before they get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR
